definition: to put on weight/to get fat
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Don't gobble down your food. It'll make you fat if you do.
sentences.chinese: 吃东西时切忌狼吞虎咽，这可能会让你发胖。

sentences.english: He would put on weight if he ate too much.
sentences.chinese: 他本来是会发胖的，可是他加意节食，起根不会多吃。

sentences.english: Jack had allowed  himself to become fat.
Some national cuisines make you fat.
sentences.chinese: 有些国家的菜式也会令你发胖。

sentences.english: She was somewhat inclined to fat after forty.
sentences.chinese: 四十岁以后她有点发胖了。

sentences.english: Over-eating will help us pile on the pounds but it also comes with other health warnings.
sentences.chinese: 过度进食不仅使我们发胖，还会引起健康问题。

sentences.english: Hence, abused children may turn to overeating, which causes obesity.
sentences.chinese: 因此，受虐待的孩子会求诸于过分进食导致发胖。

sentences.english: He can eat anything and stay thin.
sentences.chinese: 他可以做到不管吃什么都不发胖。

sentences.english: The swings for both genders were more pronounced after the age of 30.
sentences.chinese: 研究还宣称在年过三十以后，男女双方都更容易发胖。

sentences.english: "Rice, bread etc. the carbohydrate easily deliver fat, will never eat.
sentences.chinese: “米饭，面包等碳水化合物容易发胖，绝对不要吃。”

sentences.english: The condition of being plump; stoutness.
When we said that Mary was getting fat, she drew herself up angrily and walked out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 当我说玛丽发胖了时，她气得挺身走出了屋子。

sentences.english: If you eat so much, you will get fat.
sentences.chinese: 你要是吃得那么多，是会发胖的。

sentences.english: You're already kind of fat. I'm worried about your health.
sentences.chinese: 你已经有点发胖了，我真担心你的健康。

sentences.english: Most slimmers end up putting weight back on.
sentences.chinese: 大多数减肥的人最后又发胖了。

sentences.english: But as well all know, chocolate is fattening.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众所周知巧克力会让人发胖。

definition: to put on weight/to get fat (a sign of prosperity, so a compliment)
to save food/to go on a diet
to lose weight (intentionally)/to slim down/(Tw) to downsize (a business)
fat (in the body, in a plant, or in food)
thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive
